statement:
The composition of two continuous mappings (when defined) is continuous.

Let $X,Y,Z$ be topological space, and let $f,g$ be mappings
$$\begin{aligned}
   f\colon X&\to& Y, \\
   g\colon Y&\to& Z.\end{aligned}$$ We wish to prove that $g\circ f$ is
continuous. Suppose $B$ is an open set in $Z$. Since $g$ is continuous,
$g^{-1}(B)$ is an open set in $Y$, and since $f$ is continuous,
$f^{-1}(g^{-1}(B))$ is an open set in $X$. Since
$f^{-1}(g^{-1}(B))=(g\circ f)^{-1}(B)$, it follows that
$(g\circ f)^{-1}(B)$ is open and the composition if continuous.
names: composition of continuous mappings is continuous
